author: S Poorvaja
text:
From marathons to turtle walks, Chennai embraces thecause with their nesting season coming to an end in March

Sunday dawned early for many runners in Chennai as they congregated on Marina Beach to participate in ‘Ridley Run,’ a marathon organised to raise awareness of the olive ridley turtles. The turtles have been frequenting the city beaches from January to March, which is their nesting season. The theme of the run was ‘conserve the endangered’ as deaths of these turtles has been alarmingly rising every year during the nesting season due to the wide-mesh trawling nets.

As the nesting season is currently on, the Students Sea Turtle Conservation Network (SSTCN) and TREE Foundation have been organising turtle walks along the coast from Neelankarai. On Saturday night, a group of school students participated in a walk organised by the SSTCN.
title: Youth join hands to save turtles
